events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection on April 30th. They submitted initial details about the accident and vehicle damage.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident based on keywords such as collision, vehicle, and accident in the customerâ€™s description.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned to handle the case and coordinate next steps with the customer.
Acknowledgment sent to the customer confirming receipt of the claim and reassuring support throughout the claims process.
Request sent to the customer for police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and any eyewitness statements related to the accident.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report, photos of the damaged car, and a written statement describing the collision.
Investigation initiated to review submitted documents, verify accident circumstances, and assess liability for the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded with clear findings indicating fault was not with the insured party, enabling prompt processing of the claim.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and rental vehicle expenses following the discovered damages.
Customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the communication and proposed resolution timeline.
The claim was officially approved to proceed with payment and finalize the coverage for repairs and associated damages.
Insurance payment was issued directly to the repair shop and to the customer for rental vehicle reimbursement as agreed.
The claim was closed after confirmation that the repair was completed and the customer was satisfied with the resolution.
